note.p: Education: B Eng (Queen's College, Belfast); MA; DSc (Roy Univ of Ireland)

Career: Associate Professor of Physiology, Yale University, USA; Lecturer on physiology, Charing Cross Hospital, London; Professor of Biochemistry, University of Liverpool (from 1902); entered Medical Research Council (1914); Professor of Biochemistry, University of Oxford (from 1920); died of pneumonia
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1927 vol 101 pp xvii-xix, plate, by Sir Frederic Gowland Hopkins
